page.title: Events
page.description:
Events are a main staple in Bus Simulator, happening every 5 minutes after the last, or 4 if the server just started, and can be seen by the blaring red lights accompanied by a siren noise for 15 seconds.

There are a bunch of events in the game. Ranging from smaller events, like looking at a mountain, all the way to time travel. The pages go more in-depth about what goes on in the event, what items could be obtained, etc.

While most of the events shown in this category are displayed officially from within the game, some are perhaps too subtle or completely invisible for it to be properly photographed, so now some of the events will have community-made icons to help represent it properly!

Note: If you are to force these events in a VIP server via the !event command, the event names are Case Sensitive. (i.e. Bloxdonalds won't be forced if you spell it with all UPPERCASE or lowercase.)
page.keywords: Roblox Bus Simualator, Main Category, Events

header.title: Events
header.description: Events are a main staple in Bus Simulator, happening every 5 minutes after the last, or 4 if the server just started.

content.text:
There are a bunch of events in the game. Ranging from smaller events, like looking at a mountain, all the way to a nuclear explosion and time travel. The pages go more in-depth about what goes on in the event, what items could be obtained, etc.

While most of the events shown in this category are displayed officially from within the game, some are perhaps too subtle or completely invisible for it to be properly photographed, so now some of the events will have community-made icons to help represent it properly!

Note: If you are to force these events in a VIP server via the !event command, the event names are Case Sensitive. (i.e. Bloxdonalds won't be forced if you spell it with all UPPERCASE or lowercase.)

They will also be provided in (parenthesis) if possible.

content.infoBoxDescription: These events are able to be forced, and are available in normal gameplay no matter the time.

items.listItemDescription: Acid Rain is an event where acid starts raining from the sky, damaging everyone as long as they are exposed, whether it'd be outside, by the stairs, or even the third floor. The event ends after a few minutes.

The Adventure Line is an event based off of the Stanley Parable, and is about the riders of the bus following The Adventure LineTM. The line leads into a sewer grate, and the music is a lower quality version of the original version from the game. The event lasts just short of a minute.

The Backwalls is a rare event where a person mentions about the bus having a few hiccups or something isn't feeling right. Afterwards all players (assuming they are not in Frost's Den) are teleported into the Backwalls, an area with random furniture and... unknown entities that lurk.

This event will also generate a new layout each time, assuming no players are in it.

Bacon Hair Event is an event where the bus encounters a Bacon Hair protest in the middle of the road. The Attacking Bacon Hairs will follow anyone that is outside and continues to do so even inside the Bus. They can also kill if they make contact with anyone. Soon afterwards, the driver will then inform all players to evacuate to the bus now. Then, the driver will speed away from the Bacon Hairs, right before ending the event.

As soon as the event starts, The Bus will encounter three Billies in the distance, similar to <text style="color: #eb4034;">Ectta in Question Time</text> as well as <text style="color: #eb4034;">Teddy in it's titular event</text>. It will then introduce and ask the player if they would like to be a Billy. If you decline or agree they will say that they will take over Roblox as more Billies start spawning around The Bus, as well as a machine landing behind the three original Billies, with a low-quality explosion png.

Bus Birthday is an event where a random player is chosen to be celebrated for their birthday. The player will get a <text style="color: #eb4034;">Birthday Ice Cream</text> instantly, and everyone will get <text style="color: #eb4034;">Free-modelled Cake</text> shortly.

During the event, players would notice a blizzard forming as the biome forcibly changes to Snowy then Frozen, and would have to start huddling in order to prevent taking damage.

The damage can vary based on where you are, with the most exposure dealing the most damage such as Beter Box or the third floor on The Bus, to the least exposure dealing minimal damage like the first floor. This then decreases afterwards at some point in the event.

When this event happens, The Bus will stop and a random player will mention seeing a Bloxdonalds in the distance. Players are then able to go inside the building and receive a <text style="color: #eb4034;">Burger</text>. After some time has passed, the driver will mention an oddity within the burgers and afterwards leave, ending the event.

Broken Down is a simple event in Bus Simulator where <text style="color: #eb4034;">The Bus</text> breaks down in the middle of the road, giving players the ability to push the bus back to its normal speed by using a push part at the back of the bus.

Cave event is an event that takes place in a cave. When this happens, the Driver mentions there is a Cave ahead. Then, within seconds, the map becomes dark and changes to a cave. Then eventually the bus begins to drive through the cave. Then within 50 seconds, the driver mentions they are halfway out and then tells the passengers to hang on tight and then the map becomes darker. And then after that, the map changes to the region the bus was driving on before.
The Clone Event is an event in Bus Simulator, where the bus gets cloned. Eventually it turns out it's unstable and disappears shortly after.

During the event, cubes move all around the bus, playing many xylophone notes. After some time, the driver announces they've convinced the cubes to go back to Nintendo Land. A few moments after that, the event ends.

The EA Sellout or its more technical name, Bought Out is an event where everyone will be forcibly teleported back to the first floor of the Bus after having been bought out by Economic Arcs, a parody of Electronic Arts.

The Exploiter event is an event where an exploiter (of which is not a real exploiter) deletes the road and the terrain. Shortly after some comedic stabs at the creator of the game, the terrain and road restore themselves back to normal, and everything returns back to normal.

The Fake No Gas event is an event where the bus stops, and the driver acts like they're out of gas. Shortly afterwards, pranking the passengers once again, acting as a sequel to the Fake Bus Stop event.

The Flash Flood or just simply called Flood, is an event where the bus becomes flooded slowly until it reaches the third floor. Players will have to swim by holding Q and seek high ground before they drown, those that are in seats will also be automatically dismounted once the water hits them unless they hold Q as mentioned earlier. Eventually, the water will dissipate and the event ends right after.
The Gandalf event is a reference to <highlight>The Lord of the Rings</highlight>, where Gandalf stops the bus while yelling "YOU SHALL NOT PASS!"

Glacier Cave is a rare event in Bus Simulator where the Bus stops next to a cave, players are able to enter through the cave through any means of traversal until they are teleported to the interior of the cave. The event ends shortly afterwards.

The Glitches Event is an event that slowly starts changing biomes, and gets faster per biome change. The event goes through every biome in the game, including one that is only seen via !map in a VIP server, or in the <highlight>Exploiter</highlight> event, the Void biome.
ItemDescription

The Hyperspeed event is an event that causes the bus to suddenly speed up, and a yellow trail is emitted from the tires. As well as this, a portion of the instrumental of <highlight>Running in the 90's by Max Coveri</highlight> plays during the event.

The In The Sky event, or known as Falling from the Sky event, is an event that teleports the bus instantly into the skies, making the bus fall down at immense speeds. It is highly recommended not to jump or go to the third floor as you will be instantly blown away from the bus. Eventually though, it ends as the bus falls down back on the ground.

The Lava Floor, or commonly known as The Floor is Lava event, is a sudden, yet deadly event in Bus Simulator, where for the remainder of around a minute, stepping on any ground at all whether it'd be furniture, floors, or parts will end up swiftly dealing damage. It can be outpaced however by healing items such as <highlight>Cola</highlight>, <highlight>Homemade Coffee</highlight>, and a few others.

The Mountain is a pretty basic event in Bus Simulator, where the bus stops at a nearby mountain, after a while the driver tells everyone to get back to the bus, and the event ends. You may encounter ducks in a pond that quack occasionally.

The No Dough event is an event where the bus runs out of gas, but nobody can afford to buy gas. The bus then pulls up at a house, with the passengers needing to break in via chimney to get some money and escape unnoticed. The house is randomized per event including decoration and furniture, so there is no clear way on how to get to the money every time. You are given 10 minutes to find the stash of money. if somebody finds it, everybody participating in the event is given 5 minutes to return back to the bus via escaping the same way you enter, and people can't re-enter.

The No Gas event, or internally known as Gas Up, is the true version of the <highlight>Fake No Gas</highlight>, where instead of the bus driver fooling their passengers again, the bus actually runs out of gas and the players will have to collect 6 gas cans near the road.

Noble's House is an event where the bus ends up crashing onto the house owned and lived by Noble, which coincidentally is in the middle of the road. Afterwards the players can go around the house, finding a <highlight>hidden gameboy link</highlight> behind Noble's Desktop, a <highlight>Cola</highlight> and <highlight>Cold Cola</highlight> from the fridge, and an interact-able TV and remote. Following a few minutes after, the bus driver destroys Noble's house further until the bus breaks past and then the event ends afterwards.

The nothing event is well... nothing? There isn't much to detail for this event other than a conversation of dialogue between the player and the event, but that's it. There is no hidden features into it, no special dialogue or any happenings, you just wasted 5 minutes of waiting for a single event for nothing, meaning you have to wait another 5 minutes to hopefully not get the same event twice in a row.

During the event, the bus would stop for a while, while it's stopped the driver would try to figure out what the object is in the sky until sirens go off. After that, the bus start to driver at a quick pace while the nuke strikes. After a few seconds, the driver manages to drive away from the blast, and slow back down to default speed afterwards.

Obby is a simple event in Bus Simulator, where the bus briefly stops at a small obby next to the sidewalk of the road. The players can choose to complete it in any way possible, being awarded with a can of <highlight>Hyper Soda</highlight> at the end. The event ends shortly afterwards.

The Pain Ball is a short, but very loud event where a ball will be slammed into the windshield, causing screams of pain in the process. Eventually after a while of screaming, the driver finds a way to wipe it off of the windshield, and it succeeds, ending the event.

The passenger event is a very simple event, where the bus stops at a stop as passengers hop inside the bus. A player will say "This feels similar to another game", a reference to Bus Stop Simulator and the event ends. The NPCs are randomly generated from existing user IDs, and there's a chance you can see NobleReigns friends.
The bus would stop and a picnic would spawn, you can obtain the <highlight>Sandwich</highlight> there, after a bit the bus would leave and the event would end.

During the event, it would start immediately with police officers chasing the bus. After a few seconds the bus would speed up and a helicopter would spawn, after a few seconds the bus would outrun the police and the event would end.

The Pool is a short and simple event, where a pool will magically spawn next to the edge of the third floor in <highlight>The Bus</highlight>, within this pool will contain a few ducks and <highlight>Coffee</highlight>, which acts similarly in function to <highlight>Cola</highlight>.

Question Time is an event where Ectta runs up to the bus, making it stop, and asks you a question. You will get a custom chat tag based off of what you answer for 7 minutes. If you do not answer the question on time, you will get an <highlight>[abstained]</highlight> tag.

The Repaint Event is an event that happens every 5 minutes at random, giving players the option to vote for what color that should be painted onto <highlight>The Bus</highlight> for around 16-20 minutes (or roughly 3-4 events).

The Shack is an event in Bus Simulator, where the Bus stops at an abandoned shack, within the shack contains a <highlight>Fake Rocket Launcher</highlight> that will explode the holder on use. Soon after the driver mentions their unease and promptly leaves the shack, ending the event.

Soda Stand is an event where the bus will stop next to a random soda stand. The driver says that someone is handing out free soda. Players can click on MiroCev and can receive get a <highlight>Lemon Soda</highlight>. Within less than a minute, the driver mentions the soda killed their dog and that they have to evacuate to the bus. This is referenced in a news article.

The Space Event is an event in Bus Simulator, where the map is instantly changed to be in space. During this event, all players' gravity will be drastically reduced, with gravity-related items like the <highlight>Gas Station Gravity Coil</highlight> being able to make players shoot up into outer space.
Steven Ride event or known as Steven_Scripts (Event), is an event that is almost identical to the <highlight>Passengers</highlight> event in Bus Simulator.
This event has two unique descriptions. Click here for more information.

The Time Travel event is an event in Bus Simulator, where the bus momentarily stops only to speed up to time travel 50 years into the future. After the acceleration the atmosphere changes into a de-saturated and worn down city from Bus Stop Simulator, a possible prequel to Bus Simulator. In this you can find a broken down Bloxdonalds with a bent tile that leads to a bean bunker that is essentially inaccessible <highlight>Cramped Cola</highlight>. You may also find a gravestone next to Bloxdonalds as well.
The Timmy Event is a short yet simple event in Bus Simulator. When this event happens, the Bus will move backwards rather than forwards, as well as the gravity being significantly reduced
The Traffic Light event is a rather simple and straight-forward, when this event is rolled, the bus will stop and waits until the traffic light turns back to green because they are a good driver.

content.infoBoxDescription: These events can't be forced, and is no longer available on the game.

items.listItemDescription: Santa's Gone was a limited time event that came before the No Dough event, which was a limited time event in <highlight>December 2021</highlight> and <highlight>2022</highlight>.
